unreleased:0de12b49af6c:
### Overview
- Added GitHub Copilot and Google Gemini as new LLM backend options for changelog summarization
- Expanded configuration and workflow integration for the new LLM backends
- Refactored and consolidated the changelog utilities into a modular architecture
- Improved test coverage and live agent validation for the changelog system
- Reorganized the project script structure into a more logical directory layout

### New Features
- Add GitHub Copilot as LLM backend option for changelog summarization
- Add Google Gemini CLI as new LLM backend option for changelog summarization

### Code Refactoring
- Consolidated LLM output normalization into generate_release_notes.py
- Refactored changelog tools into modular architecture in changelog_utils.py
- Centralized VKB-Link management logic into VKBLinkManager
- Reorganized scripts into logical subdirectories
- Consolidated redundant script logic into changelog_utils

### Bug Fixes
- Fix GitHub Copilot CLI integration to use Windows app and prompt mode
- Default Copilot backend to gpt-4.1 model (included, no token cost)
- Fix Copilot CLI input handling to use stdin instead of command-line arguments
- Fix Gemini CLI hang by switching to stdin for prompts

### Configuration Cleanup
- Add Copilot and Gemini backends to release workflow and CLI tools
- Expand VS Code tasks with new script paths after restructuring

### Documentation Update
- Added GEMINI.md with workspace and changelog policies
- Updated AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, and DEVELOPMENT.md with new script locations

### Test Updates
- Added comprehensive tests for changelog utilities and normalization
- Implemented optional live agent tests with output validation
- Added consolidation and regression tests for VKB-Link management

Overall, the unreleased changes focused on expanding the LLM backend options, refactoring the changelog tooling into a more modular architecture, improving test coverage, and reorganizing the project scripts. These changes aim to provide more flexibility, robustness, and maintainability for the changelog system.
